interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: WKRP in Cincinnati: The Complete Series [DVD]
Review Date: 2014/09/17
Store: Howard Hesseman  (Actor),     Frank Bonner  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Comedy
Product Description: ['Product Description', "Pairing an impeccable ensemble cast with hilarious wit and popular tunes, WKRP in Cincinnati celebrated four amazing seasons, making it the quintessential situation comedy for any music lover! Join everyone's favorite radio DJs—the rockin' Dr. Johnny Fever (Howard Hesseman) and the soulful Venus Flytrap (Tim Reid)—as they weave through the inner-office antics of the crazy WKRP staff including the station's steady program director Andy (Gary Sandy), indecisive manager Carlson (Gordon Jump), smarmy advertising executive Herb (Frank Bonner), quirky news man Les Nessman (Richard Sanders), shy ingénue Bailey (Jan Smithers) and, of course, the station's lovely receptionist, Jennifer (Loni Anderson). So sit back and enjoy the sound of uproarious laughter as you watch all 90 episodes of this iconic series!", 'Bonus Content:', 'Disc 13:', 'WKRP in Cincinnati: A Paley Center Reunion', 'WKRP in Cincinnati: A Paley Center Reunion', '"Do My Eyes Say Yes?" Featurette', '"Do My Eyes Say Yes?" Featurette', '"A \'Fish Story\' Story" Featurette', '"A \'Fish Story\' Story" Featurette', 'A Conversation with Gary Sandy', 'A Conversation with Gary Sandy', ']]>', 'Review', 'Shout! Factory has done yeoman’s work in trying to correct this with', 'WKRP in Cincinnati: The Complete Series', '...The image quality, considering this series was originally shot on video tape, is almost uniformly outstanding. And, once again, Andy is overseeing a station playing the likes of Bruce Springsteen, the Rolling Stones, AC/DC, the Grateful Dead, Tom Petty, Elvis Costello, the Cars, Wings and the Police, instead of a series of featureless Muzak tracks.  Nick DeRiso -Nick DeRisosomethingelsereviews.com']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy/Television, Television', 'Format': 'DVD', 'Contributor': 'Richard Sanders, Loni Anderson, Frank Bonner, Howard Hesseman, Gordon Jump, Hugh Wilson, Gary Sandy, Jan Smithers, Tim ReidRichard Sanders, Loni Anderson, Frank Bonner, Howard Hesseman, Gordon Jump, Hugh Wilson, Gary Sandy, Jan Smithers, Tim Reid  See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '12', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.45 Pounds', 'Item model number': 'generic', 'Media Format': 'DVD', 'Run time': '37 hours and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 17, 2018', 'Actors': 'Howard Hesseman, Frank Bonner, Gary Sandy, Tim Reid, Richard Sanders', 'Subtitles': 'Afrikaans', 'Studio': 'SHOUT! FACTORY', 'Number of discs': '12'}
Review Text: This was a great series for sure and the music is important to me.  However, I also want a great picture.  Too many of the Shout Factory TV series releases video and sound quality have been poor.  I just watched a video teaser on the Shout website and if this is the same quality as the actual release, we are all in for a real treat.  This looks so much better than the original TV broadcasts.  Can't wait to see this.....
Review Title: Music important, but so is picture quality
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Don't Go Near The Water (Remastered)
Charles Walters  (Director),     Glenn Ford  (Actor),     Gia Scala  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
["They also serve who only sit and type! Hollywood brought audiences to atten-hut! in the 1950s and '60s with a string of military comedies like Mr. Roberts, Operation Petticoat, Ensign Pulver, No Time for Sergeants and this splash into the typing pool of dry-land sailors -- a Navy publicity team in the World War II Pacific. Glenn Ford, who appeared in a fistful of the era's service comedies, stars as a lieutenant with a knack for PR activities like placating big shots, calming romantic waters, deflating puffed-up journalists and puffing a profane-mouthed gob into the public's idea of the perfect enlisted man. Also in the large, shipshape cast: Anne Francis, Keenan Wynn and Mickey Shaughnessy."]
{'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'NTSC, Original recording remastered', 'Contributor': 'Glenn Ford, Eva Gabor, Anne Francis, Charles Walters, Gia Scala, Earl Holliman, Keenan Wynn, Jeff Richards, Fred Clark, Russ TamblynGlenn Ford, Eva Gabor, Anne Francis, Charles Walters, Gia Scala, Earl Holliman, Keenan Wynn, Jeff Richards, Fred Clark, Russ Tamblyn   See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.12 Ounces', 'Director': 'Charles Walters', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Original recording remastered', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 1, 2011', 'Actors': 'Glenn Ford, Gia Scala, Earl Holliman, Anne Francis, Keenan Wynn', 'Studio': 'MGM', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
This has always been one of my favorite movies. I was so happy to see it finally release on DVD.  However, Warner Brothers could have done a much better job on the DVD.  It is shown in a 2.35:1 widescreen format.  I believe that Amazon said 1.78:1, which is incorrect.  The case says remastered, but I found the quality of the picture way below what it should be.  The picture is grainy and the sound is only so-so.  For the price, I was expecting better.  There are NO SUBTITLES.  You would think if it was "remastered" they could at least add that feature.  Having said all this, the movie is still a hoot.  Glad to add it to my dvd collection.  They just don't make them this entertaining anymore.
WB could have done better!

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interest:** Classic Comedy Films and Television
- **Content Preference:** Strong affinity for military-themed comedies from the 1950s and 1960s, along with a nostalgic appreciation for iconic sitcoms, indicating a well-rounded love for classic entertainment.
- **Format:** Prefers DVDs, especially remastered versions, demonstrating a strong emphasis on quality in presentation and nostalgia.
- **Quality Expectations:** High standards for picture and sound quality, expressing disappointment with previous releases that did not meet these expectations, suggesting the user prioritizes technical excellence in all media.
- **Purchase Behavior:** Actively collects favorite classic films and TV series, showcasing a pattern of nostalgia-driven purchasing. Enjoyment of content persists despite technical shortcomings, reflecting a balance between appreciation for the work and discerning quality.
- **Review Tendencies:** Provides balanced, detailed reviews that highlight both positive aspects and areas for improvement. The user demonstrates a thoughtful and critical approach to sharing feedback on purchases.
- **Engagement with Content:** Clearly enjoys discussing and sharing thoughts on films and television, as evidenced by detailed reviews, showcasing a commitment to community engagement and appreciation for others’ opinions.

Overall, the user’s tendencies highlight a dedicated movie and television enthusiast who values historical significance, entertainment quality, and technical excellence in classic media.
